bugs.title: CVE-2022-41317 squid: exposure of sensitive information in cache manager [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-41317 squid: exposure of sensitive information in cache manager [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-41317 squid: exposure of sensitive information in cache manager

long_desc.thetext:
Exposure of Sensitive Information in Cache Manager 
https://github.com/squid-cache/squid/security/advisories/GHSA-rcg9-7fqm-83mq

Created clustal-omega tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2129772]


Created squid tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2129773]

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2129770,2129773

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

bugs.title: CVE-2022-41318 squid: buffer-over-read in SSPI and SMB authentication [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-41318 squid: buffer-over-read in SSPI and SMB authentication [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2022-41318 squid: buffer-over-read in SSPI and SMB authentication

long_desc.thetext:
Buffer Over Read in SSPI and SMB Authentication 
https://github.com/squid-cache/squid/security/advisories/GHSA-394c-rr7q-6g78

Created squid tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2129774]
Squid packages in RHEL are built with --enable-auth-ntlm="SMB_LM,fake" so they all seem affected.

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.1 Update Services for SAP Solutions

Via RHSA-2022:6774 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2022:6774

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.4 Extended Update Support

Via RHSA-2022:6776 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2022:6776

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8

Via RHSA-2022:6775 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2022:6775

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.2 Extended Update Support

Via RHSA-2022:6777 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2022:6777

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7

Via RHSA-2022:6815 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2022:6815

This issue has been addressed in the following products:

  Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9

Via RHSA-2022:6839 https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2022:6839

This bug is now closed. Further updates for individual products will be reflected on the CVE page(s):

https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2022-41318
